column1: Nen Lalaith was a babbling stream that rose under the mountain of Amon Darthir in the Ered Wethrin
column2: and flowed north-westwards out onto the shaded plains of Dor-lómin. There
column3: it trickled past the house of Húrin
column4: and was said to have given its name to his ill-fated young daughter
